result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A Brees

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK; Court Reporter-Mary Heederik] 
case called at 8:50am.
Defendant Brandon A Brees in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Brees waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess 8:56am

NEXT:   Status Conference on December 6th at 11:00am
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
DA Routing Slip
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ae] case called 1:50 PM  Defendant Brandon A Brees in court.  Attorney Karl E Huebner in court for Brandon A Brees.  ADA Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties. Scheduling discussed 
recess: 1:51 pm
NEXT: (1) 10/12/22 at 11 am (2) STC 10/21/22 at 8:30 am
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
for attorney fees
Amended Bond

[MK] case called at 1:14pm 
Defendant Brandon A Brees in court. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Right to counsel is reviewed.  Mr. Brees indicates he has the petition-form to request appointment of counsel, but he has not filled it out yet.
[off-record for the Court to make inquiries regarding the Defendant's financial status]
The Court grants Mr. Brees' request for the appointment of counsel.   
The Court continues to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits.

Attorney Flint raises that the victim has requested that bond-conditions be imposed to prohibit contact with the victim and to prohibit the defendant's presence at the victim's home, school, or work, and no presence at a specified location.
The Court amends the Bond to add a condition of:  no direct contact with the Victim; this includes no calling or texting the VIctim, and no having a third party other than an attorney contact the Victim.  
recess 1:26 pm. 

NEXT:  (1) appointment of counsel for Mr. Brees,  (2) Adjourned Initial Appearance on September 21st at 1:15pm
Adjourned initial appearance on August 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:50pm 
Defendant Brandon A Brees in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for State of Wisconsin. 
This case is scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance today.  
Right to counsel is reviewed. Mr. Brees indicates that his attorney in Illinois is making efforts to refer him to an attorney in this area.  The Court provides information regarding applying for representation at the Public Defenders Office and for petitioning the court-appointed counsel.
The Court continues to toll the preliminary hearing time limits.
recess 2:55pm

NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on August 26th at 1:15pm.
Bond Payment information

[ma] Case called at 1:36pm
Defendant Brandon A Brees appears in court, in custody with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only--Def. declined to be evaluated).  
Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.


The Court requires a $150  CASH Bond
recess 1:41 pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 7/29/22 at 2:30pm
Extradition Forecast

[ae] case called 11:21 AM Defendant Brandon A Brees not in court. ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and issues warrant body only.  
Recess 11:24 AM
